awardEventDetails.title: 2023 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year

awardEventDetails.title: 2021 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (BETTER CALL SAUL continues its monumental crawl through the desert of moral ambiguity as its soul breaks from bad to worse. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould expand the shameless indignities of personal ambition with every weapon in their narrative arsenal as Bob Odenkirk's pitifully hilarious opportunist finds an equally righteous void in the masterful turn of Rhea Seehorn's Kim Wexler. Together, they worm their way through an imagined American dream.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2019 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (BETTER CALL SAUL continues to soar as television's most loveable low-life continues to fall. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould expertly imagine the endless trials of seeking validation as a bittersweet meditation on the perils of ambition without conscience. The butt of this tragic joke is the slickest of shysters, played with a complexity beyond compare by the masterful Bob Odenkirk.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2017 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (BETTER CALL SAUL rises to new heights in its second year, if only to illustrate how far its unscrupulous hero can fail, fall and fly again. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould heap endless trials upon Bob Odenkirk's colorful hustler as he wiles his way through clashes with friends, foes and an electric sibling rivalry that proves against the allure of a con, he just can't help himself.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (BETTER CALL SAUL makes its name on the bad breaks of its desperate shyster hero, deftly shifting tone from comedy to tragedy and back again. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould cast a glance back to imagine a past all new and equally undeniable, as Bob Odenkirk embodies the series' slippery spirit with a masterful sad-sack performance, always looking for validation and an angle.)

awardsHtml:
60 wins & 283 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series
Bob Odenkirk (For playing: "Jimmy McGill/Saul Goodman".)
2022 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series
Rhea Seehorn (For playing: "Kim Wexler".)
2022 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Writing for a Drama Series
Thomas Schnauz (written by) (For "Plan and Execution (2022)")
2022 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Editing for a Comedy or Drama Series (One Hour)
Kurt Nicholas Forshager (co-supervising sound editor) - Kathryn Madsen (co-supervising sound editor) - Jane Boegel (dialogue editor) - Matt Temple (sound effects editor) - Marc Glassman (sound effects editor) - Jeffrey Cranford (foley editor) - Jason Tregoe Newman (music editor) - Gregg Barbanell (foley artist) - Alex Ullrich (foley artist) (For "Carrot and Stick (2022)")
2022 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy or Drama Series (One Hour)
Larry Benjamin (re-recording mixer) - Kevin Valentine (re-recording mixer) - Phillip W. Palmer (production mixer) (For "Carrot and Stick (2022)")

AFI Awards, USA

2023 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
2021 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(BETTER CALL SAUL continues its monumental crawl through the desert of moral ambiguity as its soul breaks from bad to worse. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould expand the shameless indignities of personal ambition with every weapon in their narrative arsenal as Bob Odenkirk's pitifully hilarious opportunist finds an equally righteous void in the masterful turn of Rhea Seehorn's Kim Wexler. Together, they worm their way through an imagined American dream.)
2019 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(BETTER CALL SAUL continues to soar as television's most loveable low-life continues to fall. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould expertly imagine the endless trials of seeking validation as a bittersweet meditation on the perils of ambition without conscience. The butt of this tragic joke is the slickest of shysters, played with a complexity beyond compare by the masterful Bob Odenkirk.)
2017 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(BETTER CALL SAUL rises to new heights in its second year, if only to illustrate how far its unscrupulous hero can fail, fall and fly again. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould heap endless trials upon Bob Odenkirk's colorful hustler as he wiles his way through clashes with friends, foes and an electric sibling rivalry that proves against the allure of a con, he just can't help himself.)
2016 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(BETTER CALL SAUL makes its name on the bad breaks of its desperate shyster hero, deftly shifting tone from comedy to tragedy and back again. Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould cast a glance back to imagine a past all new and equally undeniable, as Bob Odenkirk embodies the series' slippery spirit with a masterful sad-sack performance, always looking for validation and an angle.)
